intro: Cissampelos benthamiana, commonly known as the Benthams' moonvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and distinctive, showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ethnobotanical studies.
